snippet: At Comic-Con in San Diego, professors, psychologists and lawyers add dark strokes to a scene of light sabers, superhero costumes and explosion-filled movie trailers.
abstract: Topics at the Comic-Con International fan convention in San Diego are more serious than in the past, running the gamut from the plight of indigenous peoples to progressive politics in comics and of course the many financial and copyright issues created by the explosion in Hollywood’s interest; fantasy has become big business--7 of last year’s 10 top-grossing movies were either science fiction or comic-book-inspired--and a new anxiety has settled over the convention about the future of the business and over comics themselves.
lead_paragraph: At Comic-Con in San Diego, professors, psychologists and lawyers add dark strokes to a scene of light sabers, superhero costumes and explosion-filled movie trailers.
